meanings.sent1: Some teachers oversimplify complex topics, making them too easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to oversimplify important issues, as they require careful consideration.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to oversimplify the recipe, but ended up with a tasteless dish.
meanings.sent4: Her explanation was like trying to oversimplify a symphony into a single note.
meanings.sent5: He always tends to oversimplify things, missing out on important details.

meanings.definition: To make (something) seem simpler than it really is
meanings.sent1: Politicians often oversimplify complex policies to gain public support.
meanings.sent2: Advertisers sometimes oversimplify the benefits of their products to attract customers.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to oversimplify the illusion, making it more impressive.
meanings.sent4: Her smile oversimplified the pain she was feeling inside.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting oversimplified the beauty of the sunset, capturing only its essence.
